title: [$250] Optimize `getOptionData`

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Background The Expensify app’s left-hand navigation (LHN) sidebar lists reports. Each report needs option metadata for display. This involves filtering participants (e.g., hiding the current user, handling visibility rules) and tracking report attributes for React re-renders. The `getOptionData` function prepares this data and is called frequently. `OptionRowLHNData` wraps it in `useMemo` to avoid unnecessary recalculations, but the current setup still causes performance bottlenecks. ### Problem When user is in Most Recent mode, and the sidebar renders options for a large amount of reports, it calls `getParticipantsAccountIDsForDisplay` multiple times with different parameters and tracks unnecessary dependencies in React’s useMemo hook, which causes redundant computation of participant filtering logic and unnecessary re-renders when irrelevant report attributes change, which prevents the sidebar from rendering efficiently. ### Solution Reduce `getParticipantsAccountIDsForDisplay` function calls by extracting part of the logic responsible for filtering the results for different use cases into separate function so it’s not needed to call the original function multiple times. Additionally, remove `reportAttributes` from the `useMemo` dependency array. `getOptionData` only uses three properties from it: `reportName`, `brickRoadStatus` and `reportErrors`. The first two are already included in the array, and we should explicitly check whether the `reportErrors` object has changed to avoid unnecessary calls. On iOS, when creating a new chat with ~2k reports and ~28k personal details, `getOptionData` time went from **~900ms** to **~150ms.**

**Version Number:** 9.2.13-0

**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Open source](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1756736768266859)

## Action Performed:
1. Create a workspace
2. Send Expense
3. Go to Report page
4. Hover over the avatars at the header
5. Create one more expense in this chat
6. Hover over the avatars at the header
7. Click on one of the expenses in the list
8. Hover over the avatars at the header in RHP
## Expected Result:
The cursor should be of type `pointer`, as the avatar can be clicked on
## Actual Result:
The cursor is of text type, which leads to poor UX
## Workaround:
Unknown

title: [$250] If an expense report is not eligible to have reports moved to it, don't show it in the list

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** **Reproducible in production?:** **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1757535644671009) ## Action Performed: **Account pre-reqs:** instant submit is turned on, there are no approvers in the workflow, and the report that you are going to move expenses to contains only non-reimbursable expenses. 1. Select expenses on an open report 2. Click More > move expenses 3. Select the report that meets the **account pre-reqs** from above 4. You will see that the expenses do not move to the new report, and there is no error message or warning to indicate to the customer why ## Expected Result: What should happen is that the report that is ineligible to have expenses moved to it should not even appear in the list of reports as an option to select. ## Notes from engineering: If a workspace has instant submit with no approvers, they cannot add an expense to a nonreimbursable-only report (for example, a non-reimbursable pending card expense) as these are closed automatically ``` if (Policy::isInstantSubmitEnabledWithNoApprovers(db, Report::getPolicyID(db, newMoneyRequestReportID)) && Report::hasOnlyNonReimbursableTransactions(db, newMoneyRequestReportID)) { SINFO("User is trying to add expense to Non-Reimbursable report: " << newMoneyRequestReportID << " on a policy with Instant Submit Enabled and No Approvers. "); STHROW("403 New request cannot be added to this report"); } ``` ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c259c1e-7e58-4be3-93c8-2cbe5482b78e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
